intro: Isoloma amabilis, commonly known as the sweetflower or sweetbloom, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in the spring and summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Isoloma amabilis typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its foliage is lance-shaped and has a slightly hairy texture, contributing to its ornamental appeal.
